channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition
item.description:
Sunday, August 25, 2024

City Hall will be lit White, Blue, Yellow, Green and Black to recognise Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition.

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Road Safety Week
item.description:
Monday, August 26, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Queensland Road Safety Week.

The 10th annual Queensland Road Safety Week aims to promote road safety for everyone, including drivers, passengers, riders and pedestrians. With 278 people sadly losing their lives on Queensland roads in 2023, it's more important than ever to focus on road safety, with key landmarks lit yellow as reminder.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Fashion Festival
item.description:
Tuesday, August 27, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red, White, Blue and Yellow to celebrate Brisbane Fashion Festival.

Brisbane Fashion Festival 2024 will run with an expanded program and will be staged once again in the heart of The City. This annual event is designed to shine the spotlight on our vibrant city as we launch Spring/Summer to the rest of the country. The runway this year will again be staged in a spectacular custom-built marquee with a clear-span roof offering views of the iconic Brisbane City Hall, along with a specially designed set and tiered seating to accommodate 700 guests at each show.

This Light Up is organised by: Lindsay Bennett Marketing Pty Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Start of Paris 2024 Paralympic Games
item.description:
Wednesday, August 28, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red, Blue, Green (Paralympic agitos) to support Start of Paris 2024 Paralympic Games.

Brisbane City Council celebrates the Games’ opening and sends support and best wishes to the athletes competing in this year’s event.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Wear it Purple Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 29, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support Eve of Wear it Purple Day.

“Your Passion, Your Pride”. On 30 August 2024, Wear It Purple Day is an annual LGBTIQA+ awareness day especially for young people, based in Australia. LGTBQIA+ youth and supporters wear purple to celebrate diversity and young people from the LGBTIQA+ community.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: International Overdose Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 29, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support International Overdose Awareness Day.

International Overdose Awareness Day 2024 is coming up on August 31. This day helps to spread awareness about the tragedy of overdose and share that together we can bring an end to overdose deaths in Australia. Every year thousands of Australians lose their lives to overdose - more than 2,300 overdose deaths in 2022, which is almost double the number of Australians who died in road traffic accidents (1,276) in the same period.

For more information about International Overdose Awareness Day, see https://www.overdoseday.com/.

This Light Up is organised by: Penington Institute

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Malaysia Independence Day - Merdeka Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 29, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue White Red and Yellow to recognise Malaysia Independence Day - Merdeka Day.

Merdeka Day (Independence Day) marks the anniversary of Malaya's independence as a nation on 31st August 1957. This was a vital step in Malaysia coming into being in 1963, and is celebrated as one of Malaysia's national days.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australia Malaysia Business Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Friday, August 30, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit BrisFest Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Dress to Express Day
item.description:
Friday, August 30, 2024

City Hall will be lit Purple & Orange to support Dress to Express Day.

Dress to Express Day is an annual event that raises awareness about the signs of Coercive Control in relationships, particularly through fashion. One of the first and most common signs of Coercive Control is being told what you can and cannot wear. On Dress to Express Day, community members will walk from King George Square to the Queen St Mall, dressed in an outfit that makes them feel fabulous, in solidarity with Domestic Violence survivors who are rediscovering their identity and style.

This Light Up is organised by: Beyond Dv

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Saturday, August 31, 2024

City Hall will be lit BrisFest Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

The annual Brain Injury Awareness Week raises awareness of brain injuries and its impact. The week also celebrates the achievements of the 1 in 45 Australians living with a brain injury and the commitment given to them by their families and the communities they live in. Synapse provides a range of support services for people who have been impacted by a brain injury or disability. These services promote quality of life, self-determination, and choice through information, specialist support, and targeted research activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Wattle Day
item.description:
Sunday, September 1, 2024

City Hall  will be lit Green and Gold to support National Wattle Day.

National Wattle Day occurs on 1 September each year. This Day celebrates all that the Golden Wattle means to the country and creates awareness that it is Australia's national floral emblem, as well as one of the floral emblem's for Brisbane City.

This Light Up is organised by: Wattle Day Association Inc.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, September 2, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support Prostate Cancer Awareness Month.

September marks Prostate Cancer Awareness Month and The Long Run campaign. The campaign challenges people to run 72km throughout the month of September to raise vital funds and awareness for PCFA's prostate cancer research and support services. Prostate cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia, with 1 in 5 men diagnosed before the age of 85. That's over 24,000 each year. The Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia exists to protect the health of existing and future generations of men in Australia and to improve quality of life for men and families impacted by prostate cancer. Our vision is a future where no man dies of prostate cancer and Australian men and their families get the support they need. Raising awareness of prostate cancer and inspiring locals to fundraise will help save lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Prostate Cancer Foundation of Australia Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: PKD Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, September 4, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and White to support PKD Awareness Day.

Polycystic Kidney Disease Australia exists to find a cure for PKD. We fund research. We connect and support Australians and their families with PKD. And we provide education and information to people impacted by PKD. PKD Awareness Day -pkdaustralia.org… is an important fund-raising opportunity to find a cure for PKD which affects 25,000 Australians and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Polycystic Kidney disease Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Red and White to support PKD Awareness Day.
Polycystic Kidney Disease Australia exists to find a cure for PKD. We fund research. We connect and support Australians and their families with PKD. PKD Awareness Day -https://pkdaustralia.org/pkd-awareness-day/ is an important fund-raising opportunity to find a cure for PKD which affects 25,000 Australians and their families.
This Light Up is organised by: Polycystic Kidney disease Australia

item.title: Gynaecological Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, September 5, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Gynaecological Cancer Awareness Month.

September is Gynaecological Cancer Awareness Month and we aim to raise awareness and funds to support Cherish Women's Cancer Foundation's mission to fund life-changing medical research and clinical trials to be developed and implemented quickly to find kinder ways to treat women with gynaecological cancer and to ultimately improve survival rates.

This Light Up is organised by: Cherish Women's Cancer Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Friday, September 6, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Bravehearts Day.

Bravehearts is an Australian child protection organisation solely dedicated to the holistic and co-ordinated prevention and treatment of child sexual abuse.

This Light Up is organised by: Bravehearts

item.title: Brazil Independence Day
item.description:
Saturday, September 7, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue, Green Yellow to support Brazil Independence Day.

The Independence Day of Brazil, commonly called Sete de Setembro, celebrates the independence from Portugal in 1822.

This Light Up is organised by: OBBA

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: OBBA
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Saturday, September 7, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: International Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Day
item.description:
Monday, September 9, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red to support International Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Day.

September 9 is Red Shoes Rock Day! An international day of awareness of Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD).
At 9:09 on the 9th day of the 9th month people across Australia, and around the world, collectively take a minute to pause and reflect on the struggles faced by individuals and families living with FASD.

This Light Up is organised by: Foundation for Alcohol Research and Education

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.
This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Fly the Flag Day
item.description:
Thursday, September 12, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and White to support Fly the Flag Day.

MATES in Construction is a community development charity that works in the construction and building sector to help improve mental health and reduce suicide rates. Tonight we celebrate members and volunteers of the construction industry working hard to make it a safer place to be by having life saving conversations everyday. MATES Stronger Together.
  
This Light Up is organised by: Mates in Construction

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2024 World Sepsis Day
item.description:
Friday, September 13, 2024

City Hall will be lit Magenta to support 2024 World Sepsis Day.

Sepsis is the final common pathway to death from most infectious diseases. Despite being a medical emergency, Sepsis is still not getting the attention it deserves. Awareness Saves Lives. Learn about Sepsis at www.worldsepsisday.org

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Health Qld

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Friday, September 13, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

City Hall will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.
Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane. We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.
This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd
